meanings.definition: To manipulate someone by psychological means into questioning their own sanity.
meanings.sent1: The villain tried to gaslight the hero into believing he was the one causing all the trouble.
meanings.sent2: She realized her partner was trying to gaslight her when he denied things she clearly remembered.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to gaslight the dog into thinking he had already eaten his dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her constant lies began to gaslight her own mind, making her doubt even her true memories.
meanings.sent5: The gaslighting tactics used by the con artist were so subtle, they almost went unnoticed.

meanings.definition: A type of light source that uses gas as fuel.
meanings.sent1: The old mansion was lit up by the warm glow of gaslight fixtures.
meanings.sent2: In the 19th century, gaslight was a popular choice for indoor lighting.
meanings.sent3: The cozy restaurant recreated a Victorian atmosphere with its flickering gaslight.
meanings.sent4: The eerie streets were dimly lit by the flickering gaslight, casting long shadows.
meanings.sent5: The soft hiss of the gaslight added a nostalgic touch to the room.

meanings.sent1: The theater stage was beautifully gaslit, creating a magical ambiance for the play.
meanings.sent2: They decided to gaslight the garden party to give it a vintage feel.
meanings.sent3: The prankster secretly gaslit the room, causing confusion among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The artist carefully gaslit the painting, highlighting its intricate details.
meanings.sent5: The street performers gaslit the square, attracting a crowd with their enchanting show.
